abstract.p: Correction to April 24 article about Congressional hearing in Brooklyn at which speakers urged Environmental Protection Agency to address contamination and medical problems in areas outside Lower Manhattan resulting from Sept 11 attack; EPA was not invited to testify, but agency's inspector general was; he declined invitation

block.p: An article on Tuesday about a Congressional hearing in Brooklyn at which speakers urged the Environmental Protection Agency to address contamination and medical problems in areas outside Lower Manhattan resulting from the Sept. 11 attack included incorrect information about the hearing from a spokeswoman for the E.P.A. Although the agency itself was not invited to testify, the agency's inspector general, who operates independently, was. (He declined the invitation.)
